name: physiognomically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to the physical appearance of the face: Throughout history, racial groups have been physiognomically stereotyped. Physiognomically, I pictured her as having dark skin, a small nose and mouth, and large brown eyes.
More examplesFewer examplesThe images are meant to give a general impression and are not physiognomically specific.The explorer made a series of physiognomically detailed drawings of the people who lived on the island.English cartoonists were often less physiognomically accurate than their French counterparts.
